cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.text:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblins you control have haste.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

rulings.text: Goblin Warchief's effect reduces only generic mana in the cost of Goblin spells you cast. For example, it doesn't reduce the cost of Skirk Prospector below {R}.

cards.originalText:
Goblin spells you play cost {1} less to play.
Goblins you control have haste.

cards.name: Grip of Chaos
cards.text: Whenever a spell or ability is put onto the stack, if it has a single target, reselect its target at random. (Select from among all legal targets.)
cards.flavor: When the world is consumed by chaos, the skilled and the foolish are on equal footing.

rulings.text: If there are multiple legal targets, it may still choose the original one.
If there are no other legal targets, it keeps its target.

The ability triggers when a spell or ability is put on the stack, and this target-changing ability itself goes on the stack. This means that the spell or ability keeps its original target until this ability resolves. You determine the new target when this ability resolves, at which time the set of legal targets may have changed.

cards.originalText: Whenever a spell or ability is put onto the stack, reselect its target at random if it has a single target. (Select from among all legal targets.)

cards.name: Misguided Rage
cards.text: Target player sacrifices a permanent.
cards.flavor: Only when the anger passed did Varv realize he had burned down his home, destroyed his weapons, and killed his friend Furt.
cards.originalText: Target player sacrifices a permanent.

cards.name: Pyrostatic Pillar
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost 3 or less, Pyrostatic Pillar deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell with converted mana cost 3 or less, Pyrostatic Pillar deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Rock Jockey
cards.text:
You can't cast this spell if you've played a land this turn.
You can't play lands if you've cast Rock Jockey this turn.
cards.flavor: Goblins don't know much about physics, but they know lots about falling and rocks.

rulings.text: The first ability applies only while this card is in your hand (or someplace else you can cast it from).
The second ability applies only while this card is on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
You can't play Rock Jockey if you played a land this turn.
You can't play lands if you played Rock Jockey this turn.

cards.name: Scattershot
cards.text:
Scattershot deals 1 damage to target creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

rulings.text: The copies are put directly onto the stack. They aren't cast and won't be counted by other spells with storm cast later in the turn.
Spells cast from zones other than a player's hand and spells that were countered are counted by the storm ability.
A copy of a spell can be countered like any other spell, but it must be countered individually. Countering a spell with storm won't affect the copies.
The triggered ability that creates the copies can itself be countered by anything that can counter a triggered ability. If it is countered, no copies will be put onto the stack.
You may choose new targets for any of the copies. You can choose differently for each copy.

cards.originalText:
Scattershot deals 1 damage to target creature.
Storm (When you play this spell, copy it for each spell played before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

cards.name: Siege-Gang Commander
cards.text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander's activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.

cards.originalText:
When Siege-Gang Commander comes into play, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Skirk Volcanist
cards.text:
Morph—Sacrifice two Mountains. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Skirk Volcanist is turned face up, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.
cards.originalText:
Morph—Sacrifice two mountains. (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Skirk Volcanist is turned face up, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Spark Spray
cards.text:
Spark Spray deals 1 damage to any target.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: It's the only kind of shower goblins will tolerate.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Spark Spray deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Sulfuric Vortex
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.

cards.name: Torrent of Fire
cards.text: Torrent of Fire deals damage to any target equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
cards.flavor: Dragon fire melts any instrument designed to measure it.
cards.originalText: Torrent of Fire deals damage equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control to target creature or player.

cards.name: Uncontrolled Infestation
cards.text:
Enchant nonbasic land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
cards.flavor: The grounds of the Riptide Project are now populated only by slivers, broken beakers, and the lonely screeching of gulls.

rulings.text: It only triggers if the land becomes tapped after this Aura is on it. Attaching it to a tapped land will not destroy the land until the next time the land is untapped and then tapped again.

cards.originalText:
Uncontrolled Infestation can enchant only a nonbasic land.
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

cards.name: Accelerated Mutation
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
cards.flavor: Its food just got a lot smaller and its stomach a lot bigger.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.

cards.name: Alpha Status
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares a creature type with it.
cards.flavor: The best leaders are made by their followers.

rulings.text: Alpha Status counts each creature once if that creature shares at least one creature type with the enchanted creature.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other creature in play that shares a creature type with it.

cards.name: Ambush Commander
cards.text:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ancient Ooze
cards.text: Ancient Ooze's power and toughness are each equal to the total converted mana cost of other creatures you control.
cards.flavor: The ooze has always been. The ooze will always be.

rulings.text: You add up the converted mana cost of all other creatures you control. Remember that tokens and face-down creatures have a cost of zero.

cards.originalText: Ancient Ooze's power and toughness are each equal to the total converted mana cost of other creatures you control.

cards.name: Break Asunder
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "No good will come of this."

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Claws of Wirewood
cards.text:
Claws of Wirewood deals 3 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: They say the forest has eyes. They never mention its claws.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Claws of Wirewood deals 3 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Decree of Savagery
cards.text:
Put four +1/+1 counters on each creature you control.
Cycling {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Savagery, you may put four +1/+1 counters on target creature.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.name: Divergent Growth
cards.text: Until end of turn, lands you control gain "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: Nature has forgotten its own rules.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, lands you control gain "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Dragon Fangs
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Fangs from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or more comes into play, you may return Dragon Fangs from your graveyard to play enchanting that creature.

cards.name: Elvish Aberration
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G}.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.

Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Search your library for a forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Fierce Empath
cards.text: When Fierce Empath enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Fierce Empath comes into play, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost 6 or more, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Forgotten Ancient
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.
cards.flavor: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

rulings.text: It does not get counters for copies of spells (as with Storm), just for spells that are actually cast.
The moving of counters is not a targeted ability.
You decide how many counters to move and where to move them when the ability resolves.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget to do so, it means you chose not to do so.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a player plays a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.

cards.name: Hunting Pack
cards.text:
Create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

rulings.text: The copies are put directly onto the stack. They aren't cast and won't be counted by other spells with storm cast later in the turn.
Spells cast from zones other than a player's hand and spells that were countered are counted by the storm ability.
A copy of a spell can be countered like any other spell, but it must be countered individually. Countering a spell with storm won't affect the copies.
The triggered ability that creates the copies can itself be countered by anything that can counter a triggered ability. If it is countered, no copies will be put onto the stack.

cards.originalText:
Put a 4/4 green Beast creature token into play.
Storm (When you play this spell, copy it for each spell played before it this turn.)

cards.name: Krosan Drover
cards.text: Creature spells you cast with converted mana cost 6 or greater cost {2} less to cast.
cards.flavor: "Sit."
cards.originalText: Creature spells you play with converted mana cost 6 or more cost {2} less to play.

cards.name: Krosan Warchief
cards.text:
Beast spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{G}: Regenerate target Beast.
cards.flavor: It turns prey into predator.
cards.originalText:
Beast spells you play cost {1} less to play.
{1}{G}: Regenerate target Beast.

cards.name: Kurgadon
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell with converted mana cost 6 or greater, put three +1/+1 counters on Kurgadon.
cards.flavor: When it walks through Krosa, trees step aside, leaves take wing, and the ground shudders.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell with converted mana cost 6 or more, put three +1/+1 counters on Kurgadon.

cards.name: One with Nature
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Primitive Etchings
cards.text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a creature card this way, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Ancient carvings in the trees of Krosa glow with power once again.

rulings.text: If you have more than one of these cards on the battlefield, only one card is revealed (both of them reveal the same card). Both of them will trigger if this card is a creature and thereby allow you to draw 2 cards.

cards.originalText: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a creature card this way, draw a card.

cards.name: Root Elemental
cards.text:
Morph {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Root Elemental is turned face up, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Morph {5}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Root Elemental is turned face up, you may put a creature card from your hand into play.

cards.name: Sprouting Vines
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

rulings.text: The copies are put directly onto the stack. They aren't cast and won't be counted by other spells with storm cast later in the turn.
Spells cast from zones other than a player's hand and spells that were countered are counted by the storm ability.
A copy of a spell can be countered like any other spell, but it must be countered individually. Countering a spell with storm won't affect the copies.
The triggered ability that creates the copies can itself be countered by anything that can counter a triggered ability. If it is countered, no copies will be put onto the stack.

cards.originalText:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Storm (When you play this spell, copy it for each spell played before it this turn.)

cards.name: Titanic Bulvox
cards.text:
Trample
Morph {4}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: With natural laws abandoned, excess thrives.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Morph {4}{G}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Treetop Scout
cards.text: Treetop Scout can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: At home among the swaying, supple branches of the treetops, some scouts live their entire lives never touching ground.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Treetop Scout can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Upwelling
cards.text: Players don't lose unspent mana as steps and phases end.
cards.flavor: Once again, Kamahl felt the full force of the Mirari's pull, but he had learned much since the last time.

rulings.text: Players can keep mana in their pool indefinitely while this is on the battlefield, but once it leaves the battlefield, they have until the end of the current step (or phase) to use the mana before it disappears.

cards.originalText: Mana pools don't empty at the end of phases or turns. (This effect stops mana burn.)

cards.name: Wirewood Guardian
cards.text: Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)
cards.flavor: Tall as a tree and probably related.

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.

Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

cards.originalText: Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Search your library for a forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Wirewood Symbiote
cards.text: Return an Elf you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: It drinks fatigue.
cards.originalText: Return an Elf you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Woodcloaker
cards.text:
Morph {2}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Woodcloaker is turned face up, target creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Morph {2}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Woodcloaker is turned face up, target creature gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Xantid Swarm
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Xantid Swarm attacks, defending player can't cast spells this turn.
cards.flavor: When they land on you, all you can think about is tearing them off.

rulings.text: The defending player may cast spells before Xantid Swarm's triggered ability resolves.
In a multiplayer game, only the player Xantid Swarm attacked is affected. Other defending players may cast spells.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Xantid Swarm attacks, defending player can't play spells this turn.

cards.name: Bladewing the Risen
cards.text:
Flying
When Bladewing the Risen enters the battlefield, you may return target Dragon permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{B}{R}: Dragon creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Bladewing the Risen comes into play, you may return target Dragon card from your graveyard to play.
{B}{R}: All Dragons get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Edgewalker
cards.text: Cleric spells you cast cost {W}{B} less to cast. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay. (For example, if you cast a Cleric spell with mana cost {1}{W}, it costs {1} to cast.)

rulings.text: If you have more than one of these on the battlefield, the cost reduction is cumulative.
You apply cost reduction effects after other cost modifiers, so it can reduce additional costs or alternative costs if they include {W} and/or {B}.

If a spell has hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost, you choose which half you will be paying before determining the total cost. If you choose to pay such a cost with {W} or {B}, Edgewalker can reduce that part of the cost.

cards.originalText: Cleric spells you play cost {W}{B} less to play. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay. (For example, if you play a Cleric with mana cost {1}{W}, it costs {1} to play.)

cards.name: Karona, False God
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps Karona, False God and gains control of it.
Whenever Karona attacks, creatures of the creature type of your choice get +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Haste
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps Karona, False God and gains control of it.
Whenever Karona attacks, creatures of the type of your choice get +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sliver Overlord
cards.text:
{3}: Search your library for a Sliver card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
{3}: Gain control of target Sliver. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: The end of evolution.
cards.originalText:
{3}: Search your library for a Sliver card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
{3}: Gain control of target Sliver. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Ark of Blight: Destroy target land.

cards.text:
Morph {0} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

Morph {0} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Proteus Machine is turned face up, its type becomes the creature type of your choice. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Stabilizer

cards.flavor:

—Pemmin, Riptide survivor

cards.flavor: Those who bring nothing to the temple take nothing away.

Flying

Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

Flying
When Angel of Mercy comes into play, you gain 3 life.

cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)

Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
cards.flavor: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.

Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.

cards.name: Blinding Light
cards.text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
cards.flavor: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.

rulings.text: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

cards.originalText: Tap all nonwhite creatures.

cards.name: Border Guard
cards.flavor: "Join the army, see foreign countries!" they'd said.

cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Put target creature card from your graveyard into play.

cards.name: Champion Lancer
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
cards.flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.

cards.name: Charging Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.
cards.originalText: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Devoted Hero
cards.flavor: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

cards.name: Devout Monk
cards.text: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Discipline wears many robes.
cards.originalText: When Devout Monk comes into play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Eager Cadet
cards.flavor: The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

cards.name: False Peace
cards.text: Target player skips all combat phases of their next turn.
cards.flavor: Mutual consent is not required for war.
cards.originalText: Target player can't attack on his or her next turn.

cards.name: Foot Soldiers
cards.flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

cards.name: Gerrard's Wisdom
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: "You'll lose a duel if your enemy comes expecting a war."
cards.originalText: For each card in your hand, you gain 2 life. (Don't count this card.)

cards.name: Knight Errant
cards.flavor:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

cards.name: Loyal Sentry
cards.text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

rulings.text: Loyal Sentry and the creature it blocks are destroyed before combat damage is dealt. The blocked creature is destroyed even if Loyal Sentry leaves the battlefield before its triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText: When Loyal Sentry blocks, destroy it and the creature it blocks. (Destroy both creatures before dealing damage.)

cards.name: Path of Peace
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

rulings.text: You are a creature's owner if the card representing it began the game in your deck, or if it's a token that entered the battlefield under your control. If Path of Peace targets a creature that you own but an opponent controls, you'll gain 4 life.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Path of Peace tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. No player gains life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

cards.name: Righteous Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Righteous Fury
cards.text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.originalText: Destroy all tapped creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Royal Falcon
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Royal Trooper
cards.text: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Fortune does not side with the faint-hearted."
—Sophocles, Phaedra
cards.originalText: When Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sacred Nectar
cards.text: You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"
cards.originalText: You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Steadfastness
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.
cards.originalText: When Venerable Monk comes into play, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Veteran Cavalier
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Veteran Cavalier to tap.

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Coral Eel
cards.flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Denizen of the Deep
cards.text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: When Denizen of the Deep comes into play, return all other creatures you control from play to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.originalText: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

cards.name: Extinguish
cards.text: Counter target sorcery spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target sorcery spell.

cards.name: Eye Spy
cards.text: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into their graveyard.
cards.originalText: Look at the top card of target player's library. Put that card back on top of that library or into that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavor: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

cards.name: Ingenious Thief
cards.text:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief comes into play, look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch.

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

cards.originalText: When Man-o'-War comes into play, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

cards.name: Owl Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Owl Familiar comes into play, draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.
cards.originalText: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.

cards.name: Piracy
cards.text: Until end of turn, you may tap lands you don't control for mana. Spend this mana only to cast spells.
cards.flavor: The sea gives, and the sea takes. Some just help with the taking.
cards.originalText: This turn, you may tap lands you don't control to help pay for your spells.

cards.name: Psychic Transfer
cards.text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

rulings.text: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

cards.originalText: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

cards.name: Ransack
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

cards.name: Relearn
cards.text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned.
cards.originalText: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Sea Eagle
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

cards.originalText: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other one on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.
cards.originalText: Flying
